queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.rules[19] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.rules[19] is granted read access (verbs: list, watch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Name Undefined Or Empty
queries.description: A Kubernetes Pod should have a Service Account defined so to restrict Kubernetes API access, which means the attribute 'serviceAccountName' should be defined and not empty.

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-alertmanager}}.apiVersion of ClusterRoleBinding  is deprecated and is {{rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1}}
metadata.name={{elasticsearch-master-pdb}}.apiVersion of PodDisruptionBudget  is deprecated and is {{policy/v1beta1}}

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
Container should not use secrets as environment variables
Service should Target a Pod

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{elasticsearch-master}}.spec.selector label refers to a Pod label
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{elasticsearch-master}}.spec.selector label does not match with any Pod label

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.spec.selector label refers to a Pod label
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.spec.selector label does not match with any Pod label

queries.description: Check if StatefulSet resources don't have a podAntiAffinity policy, which prevents multiple pods from being scheduled on the same node.
StatefulSets should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-cassandra is targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-cassandra is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
